longBusinessSummary: Hokuriku Electric Power Company supplies electricity through integrated power generation, transmission, and distribution systems in Japan. The company generates electricity through hydroelectric, thermal, and nuclear sources. It is also involved in the sale of LNG; Maintenance of electric power facilities, operation of power-related facilities; maintenance of hydroelectric power plant and transformer equipment; construction of thermal and nuclear power plant equipment; research, design, and supervision of civil engineering and construction projects; electrical work; energy solution business; development and maintenance of software; wide-area Ethernet service and corporate Internet connectivity; data center business; leasing of communication line and data transmission line services; wired TV broadcasting; environmental survey; environmental research, design, and execution of environmental greening projects; and recycling and storage of confidential documents and archives; sale of paper products. In addition, the company engages in the real estate leasing and management, temporary staffing, and equipment leasing activities; provision of nursing care/social welfare services, and telephone pole advertising and travel services; manufacture and sale of concrete poles and piles; manufacture, repair, and testing of power meters and other instrumentation; manufacture and sale of distribution switches, transformers, distribution boards, and other equipment; and operation of the Hyakusen Yokocho online store. Hokuriku Electric Power Company was founded in 1951 and is headquartered in Toyama, Japan.
